poem:
Title: Trial of a Private Eclipse

In the courtroom of whispers, a jester of power,
Where erstwhile magnates now count the hour.
Behold the circus - the sad, the absurd,
As Justice weighs facts, every syllable heard.
In the waning starlight, truth tarries,
Yet our democracy, in its scales, carries.
Oh, but to dream of days far brighter,
Than those eclipsed by a hush-money writer.
